entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, who is injured and being helped by Hagrid. ("Hagrid's huge, hairy face was swimming above Harry , blocking out the stars.")

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: A gamekeeper at Hogwarts, who is helping Harry. ("Hagrid's huge, hairy face was swimming above Harry , blocking out the stars.")

entities.name: fang
entities.description: Hagrid's dog, who is beside Harry and providing comfort. ("Harry could smell burnt wood and dog hair; he put out a hand and felt Fang’s reassuringly warm and alive body quivering beside him.")

entities.name: house
entities.description: The house that is being referred to as needing to be put out. ("We should put out your house,’ said Harry , ‘the charm’s Aguamenti ...’")

relationships.description: Hagrid is helping Harry, who is injured. ("Hagrid put his hands under Harry’s arms and raised him up with such force that Harry’s feet momentarily left the ground before Hagrid set him upright again.")
Harry is concerned about his house, which he thinks needs to be put out. ("We should put out your house,’ said Harry , ‘the charm’s Aguamenti ...’")

Hagrid is also concerned about the house, as he agrees with Harry that it needs to be put out. ("‘Knew it was summat like that,’ mumbled Hagrid, and he raised a smouldering, pink flowery umbrella and said, ‘Aguamenti!’")
